item.title: I fell in the pedestrian crossing at approx 08.45, 29th July
item.description:
Owing to the uneven nature of this pedestrian crossing, I fell and sustained an injury to my right elbow and knee. Feel free to examine any CCTV evidence. The incident took place at approximately 08.45 on 29/7/25. Before someone is seriously injured, could you PLEASE repair it (Major road, heavy footfall )

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, High Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Industrial bins blocking footpath and overflowing, 29th July
item.description:
These bins appeared recently. They are on the pavement and people from around the area are now dumping their waste in them, leading them to overflow onto the pavement and smell foul. The bins are unsafe for the children on this street, and have already attracted rats, foxes and flies. The lids are almost always open and rubbish has been blowing onto the road, across all pavements, and into the kids park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakley Place, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tents In Park, 29th July
item.description:
There have been multiple tents installed to the park near to the tennis courts. This is not allowed and need to be removed. I have seen this sporadically for a month or so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Depot Street, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip of builder’s rubble adjacent to recycling bins, 29th July
item.description:
A rogue builder is fly tipping here every week now - sometimes multiple times a week. This fly tip location needs to be kept clear because it provides vehicular access to Keston House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Painted graffiti on the paved area in front of St Mary’s Church, 29th July
item.description:
There is extensive chalk graffiti as usual in front of the church which, inevitably, has now escalated to painted graffiti. There are at least 4 instances of painted graffiti. It will attract more and more. Please can the council clean AND put up very clearly worded notices explaining that WCC has banned ALL graffiti including chalk graffiti. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 245, Old Marylebone Road, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temp traffic lights stuck in red, 29th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34-48, London Road, Forest Hill, London
